forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 4pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. South wind 2 to 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 50, with temperatures rising to around 56 overnight. South southeast wind 1 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 48 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between 1 and 2 inches possible.

weather_report:
As the afternoon unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, a dense curtain of clouds looms overhead, casting a muted pallor across the cityscape. The promise of rain lingers like a whisper, forecasted to arrive shortly after 4 PM. With temperatures hovering in the mid-fifties, a chill seeps in alongside the gentle south wind, which may be felt more as a nostalgic sigh than a true breeze. The air, pregnant with moisture, hints at the impending storm, and a 90% chance of precipitation looms—an unwavering certainty of the world outside.

Tonight, the rain will gather intensity, ushering in temperatures that rise through the evening, reflecting the warmth of an approaching front. As winds whip from the southeast, gusting as high as 48 mph, the atmosphere transforms. In this scenario, fog may emerge along the bay, shrouding the iconic landmarks in a haunting mist that both obscures and enhances their mystique. Given this weather, layers are advisable; a sturdy raincoat and waterproof shoes will serve well against the impending downpour. Activities may best be suited to indoor pursuits: perhaps read that novel you've neglected, or indulge in a warm beverage from a nearby café. San Francisco's cozy establishments await, ready to offer refuge from the storm raging just outside, as the city revels in its ethereal, rain-soaked charm.
